member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
This is a sub-namespace of this library for web use, it extends the core namespace to support ASP.NET and handles caching for DocumentViewer.
The main classes in this namespace are:
is the class for handling caching of documents.
is the class for changing this library's configuration for web use (e.g. setting cache location for DocumentViewer).

member.summary: Defines posible match options for text search in the viewer.

member.summary: No specific match option.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.MatchOptions.MatchAnyWord
member.summary: The search should match the term as a whole or match any word in the term separately (e.g. "bicycle bells" or "bicycle" or "bells").

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.MatchOptions.MatchCase
member.summary: The search should be case sensitive, i.e the found text must match the case of the search term.

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.MatchOptions.MatchWholeWord
member.summary: The search should match the whole word only, i.e the found text must be a whole word (surrounded by a non-word character). (e.g. "doc" matches " doc " or ".doc" but not "document").

member.name: F:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.MatchOptions.UseWildcard
member.summary: The search should treat * (asterisk) character in the search term as a wildcard. Wildcard * matches zero or more characters.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.AllowedPermissions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the allowed permissions for the document viewer. The default is . Denied permissions take precedence over allowed permissions. For instance, when is set to and is set to and all permissions except Download and Print will be allowed. When combining permissions, they should be separated by comma in string and by bitwise 'or' operator in code (| in C# and OR in VB).

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.DeniedPermissions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the denied permissions for the document viewer. The default is . Denied permissions take precedence over allowed permissions. For instance, when is set to and is set to and all permissions except Download and Print will be allowed. When combining permissions, they should be separated by comma in string and by bitwise 'or' operator in code (| in C# and OR in VB).

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.FitMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the initial mode for fitting pages to the viewer. The default is .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.LayoutMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the initial mode for placing pages within the viewer. The default is .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.MobileMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies which mobile device type to use mobile document viewer on. The default is . Note that using full document viewer on mobile devices would cause performance issues (slow rendering), so you should prefer mobile document viewer which is optimized for mobile devices.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.ZoomLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value in percentage that specifies the initial zoom level of the document. The default is 100. For this property to be effective property should be set to .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.DownloadUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the custom url that should be used for downloading. By default, when you click the download button, the download is handled internally by the document viewer. You can override the default behaviour by specifying your own url which handles the download.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.DownloadFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the custom file name used for downloading. This property will override the original file name specified in .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.DownloadEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether downloading the original document should be enabled. The default is true. Downloading can be disabled for security (DRM) purpose. Deprecated, please use AllowedPermissions or DeniedPermissions with DocumentViewerPermissions.Download instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.DownloadAsPdfEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether downloading a PDF version of the original document should be enabled. The default is true. Downloading as PDF can be disabled for additional security (DRM) purpose. Deprecated, please use AllowedPermissions or DeniedPermissions with DocumentViewerPermissions.DownloadAsPdf instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.PrintEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether printing the displayed document should be enabled. The default is true. Printing can be disabled for additional security (DRM) purpose. Deprecated, please use AllowedPermissions or DeniedPermissions with DocumentViewerPermissions.Print instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.TextSelectionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether selecting text in the displayed document should be enabled.The default is true. Text selection can be disabled for additional security (DRM) purpose. Deprecated, please use AllowedPermissions or DeniedPermissions with DocumentViewerPermissions.SelectText instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.ToolbarVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the top toolbar is visible. The default is true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.SidePaneVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the left side pane is visible. The default is true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the display language of the document viewer.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.LoadingMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the message displayed while the document is being prepared for the first-time viewing. For example, you can override the default message for localization purpose.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.SearchOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the text search options of the viewer. If you specify the term, an automatic search will be done when the document is displayed, i.e. the specified term will be searched and results with clickable positions will be listed on the left pane and the term will be highlighted in the pages. For example, if you launch the document viewer from a search results page, you can pass the same search term to the viewer.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.PrintOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the print options of the viewer. The options will be reflected as default values on the print dialog of the viewer.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.HighlightedKeywords
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the keywords to be highlighted when the document is displayed. For example, if you launch the document viewer from a search results page, you can pass the searched keywords. Deprecated, please use instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.HighlightedColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color to use for highlighted keywords. Default is yellow. Deprecated, please use instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.SinglePageRotationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether rotate buttons should only rotate the currently viewed page rather than all pages. The default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.Watermarks
member.summary: Gets the collection of the text or image watermarks to embed to the displayed document. Downloading as PDF will also include the same watermarks.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.InputOptions
member.summary: Gets the collection of input options used when generating the displayed document. For example, when you add an instance of to this collection, it will be used only for spreadsheet input files.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.Document
member.summary: Gets or sets the document to load and display. This is usually the path to the document to load. Both physical (eg. c:\document.docx) and virtual (eg. /document.docx or ~/document.docx) paths are supported. If a custom document handler is provided via property, then this value will be passed to that handler which should open and return a readable stream according to this file identifier. So it can be any string value that your implementation understands.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.DocumentFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the document format to use for the file specified in property. By default, the format is determined from the file extension but you can use this property when you don't have an extension or when you need to override the format determined from the extension (e.g. you want file.xml to be treated as ). This property is not effective when you use or properties because those have their own way to specify/override the document format.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.DocumentLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the file system location for the file specified in property. By default, the file is considered on disk but you can use this property to load files from any of the supported file systems like UNC paths with password, Amazon S3 and Azure Blob. When specified property should be set to a relative path for this location. (e.g. "Document.docx" or "SomeFolder\Document.docx")

Using Amazon S3 for document location:

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.DocumentHandlerType
member.summary: Gets or sets the document handler type which provides a custom way of loading the input files. This class should implement interface and should have a parameterless constructor so that it can be instantiated internally when necessary. Value of property will be passed to this handler which should open and return a readable stream according to that file identifier. So it can be any string value that your implementation understands.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.DocumentHandlerParameters
member.summary: Gets or sets a name-value collection of parameters which will be passed to your implementation specified in .

example.para: Sample IDocumentHandler implementation for passing multiple parameters at once:

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.DocumentSource
member.summary: Gets or sets the document source to load and display. This is an alternative to property. When you don't have a file on disk and implementing interface is not convenient, you can use this property to load documents from a stream or a byte array. Note that your stream or byte array will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists when you load via because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed).

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password which is used for loading a protected document.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.HighQualityEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to render high quality within DocumentViewer. The default is false. For providing some guarantees regarding how quickly a page can be rendered on different systems such as mobile devices, by default some parts of a page that are very complex and would take really long to render in the browser, are rasterized to an image (flattened). However as a side effect, parts of some pages may look blurry when you zoom in. You can set this property to true to disable this possible flattening (if you observe it's happening with your specific document). This way you can ensure vector quality rendering for complex documents such as CAD drawings. If you have errors due to insufficient memory, keep it at false. This setting does not effect the first step of the conversion: Source -> PDF, it only effects the second step of the conversion: PDF -> XPZ.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.UI.DocumentViewer.ClientLoad
member.summary: Gets or sets the client-side event raised when the document viewer has been loaded. The value should be a valid JavaScript function name which is accessible on the host page. Function names should be specified without parentheses like "FunctionName" or "Namespace.FunctionName".

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the denied permissions for the document viewer. The default is . Denied permissions take precedence over allowed permissions. For instance, when is set to and is set to and all permissions except Download and Print will be allowed. When combining permissions, they should be separated by comma in string and by bitwise 'or' operator in code (| in C# and OR in VB).

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.FitMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the initial mode for fitting pages to the viewer. The default is .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.LayoutMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the initial mode for placing pages within the viewer. The default is .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.ZoomLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a value in percentage that specifies the initial zoom level of the document. The default is 100. For this property to be effective property should be set to .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.MobileMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies which mobile device type to use mobile document viewer on. The default is . Note that using full document viewer on mobile devices would cause performance issues (slow rendering), so you should prefer mobile document viewer which is optimized for mobile devices.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.DownloadUrl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the custom url that should be used for downloading. By default, when you click the download button, the download is handled internally by the document viewer. You can override the default behaviour by specifying your own url which handles the download.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.DownloadFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the custom file name used for downloading. This property will override the original file name specified in .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.DownloadEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether downloading the original document should be enabled. The default is true. Downloading can be disabled for security (DRM) purpose. Deprecated, please use AllowedPermissions or DeniedPermissions with DocumentViewerPermissions.Download instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.DownloadAsPdfEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether downloading a PDF version of the original document should be enabled. The default is true. Downloading as PDF can be disabled for additional security (DRM) purpose. Deprecated, please use AllowedPermissions or DeniedPermissions with DocumentViewerPermissions.DownloadAsPdf instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.PrintEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether printing the displayed document should be enabled. The default is true. Printing can be disabled for additional security (DRM) purpose. Deprecated, please use AllowedPermissions or DeniedPermissions with DocumentViewerPermissions.Print instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.TextSelectionEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether selecting text in the displayed document should be enabled.The default is true. Text selection can be disabled for additional security (DRM) purpose. Deprecated, please use AllowedPermissions or DeniedPermissions with DocumentViewerPermissions.SelectText instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.ToolbarVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the top toolbar is visible. The default is true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.SidePaneVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the left side pane is visible. The default is true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.Language
member.summary: Gets or sets the display language of the document viewer.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.LoadingMessage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the message displayed while the document is being prepared for the first-time viewing. For example, you can override the default message for localization purpose.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.SearchOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the text search options of the viewer. If you specify the term, an automatic search will be done when the document is displayed, i.e. the specified term will be searched and results with clickable positions will be listed on the left pane and the term will be highlighted in the pages. For example, if you launch the document viewer from a search results page, you can pass the same search term to the viewer.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.PrintOptions
member.summary: Gets or sets the print options of the viewer. The options will be reflected as default values on the print dialog of the viewer.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.HighlightedKeywords
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the keywords to be highlighted when the document is displayed. For example, if you launch the document viewer from a search results page, you can pass the searched keywords. Deprecated, please use instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.HighlightedColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color to use for highlighted keywords. Default is yellow. Deprecated, please use instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.SinglePageRotationEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether rotate buttons should only rotate the currently viewed page rather than all pages. The default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.Watermarks
member.summary: Gets the collection of the text or image watermarks to embed to the displayed document. Downloading as PDF will also include the same watermarks.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.InputOptions
member.summary: Gets the collection of input options used when generating the displayed document. For example, when you add an instance of to this collection, it will be used only for spreadsheet input files.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.Document
member.summary: Gets or sets the document to load and display. This is usually the path to the document to load. Both physical (eg. c:\document.docx) and virtual (eg. /document.docx or ~/document.docx) paths are supported. If a custom document handler is provided via property, then this value will be passed to that handler which should open and return a readable stream according to this file identifier. So it can be any string value that your implementation understands.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.DocumentFormat
member.summary: Gets or sets the document format to use for the file specified in property. By default, the format is determined from the file extension but you can use this property when you don't have an extension or when you need to override the format determined from the extension (e.g. you want file.xml to be treated as ). This property is not effective when you use or properties because those have their own way to specify/override the document format.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.DocumentLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the file system location for the file specified in property. By default, the file is considered on disk but you can use this property to load files from any of the supported file systems like UNC paths with password, Amazon S3 and Azure Blob. When specified property should be set to a relative path for this location. (e.g. "Document.docx" or "SomeFolder\Document.docx")

member.summary: Gets or sets the document source to load and display. This is an alternative to property. When you don't have a file on disk and implementing interface is not convenient, you can use this property to load documents from a stream or a byte array. Note that your stream or byte array will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists when you load via because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed).

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.Password
member.summary: Gets or sets the password which is used for loading a protected document.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.WebForms.DocumentViewerControl.HighQualityEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to render high quality within DocumentViewer. The default is false. For providing some guarantees regarding how quickly a page can be rendered on different systems such as mobile devices, by default some parts of a page that are very complex and would take really long to render in the browser, are rasterized to an image (flattened). However as a side effect, parts of some pages may look blurry when you zoom in. You can set this property to true to disable this possible flattening (if you observe it's happening with your specific document). This way you can ensure vector quality rendering for complex documents such as CAD drawings. If you have errors due to insufficient memory, keep it at false. This setting does not effect the first step of the conversion: Source -> PDF, it only effects the second step of the conversion: PDF -> XPZ.

member.summary: Gets or sets the client-side event raised when the document viewer has been loaded. The value should be a valid JavaScript function name which is accessible on the host page. Function names should be specified without parentheses like "FunctionName" or "Namespace.FunctionName".

member.summary: Provides methods for handling caching of documents.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCache.#ctor(GleamTech.FileSystems.Location,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentUltimateConfiguration)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The location to store cached documents. The location can be a plain physical/virtual path string or a instance for one of the supported file systems like Amazon S3 and Azure Blob.
Whether encryption of documents should be enabled. The default is true.
Whether to keep variations of document conversion results. The default is false.
The configuration to use instead of the global configuration.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCache.EncryptionEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether encryption of documents should be enabled. The default is true. Document viewer downloads a special document format (XPZ) on the client-side but for additional security (DRM), the document is also encypted by default.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCache.KeepVariations
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether to keep variations of document conversion results. The default is false. For instance when you change watermark options, both Pdf and Xpz outputs are regenerated. By default the Pdf and Xpz outputs are replaced in cache when watermarks are changed. If you set this property to true, the Pdf and Xpz outputs will not be replaced but all variations will be kept in cache instead. This can be useful especially when you want different outputs for different users. So this way, for instance you can have different watermarked variations for each different user.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCache.GetCacheInfo(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentOptions)
member.summary: Gets the cache info for a document. This method can be used if you need to know the cache keys beforehand without calling method.
member.param: The document options of for pre-caching.
member.returns: A new instance.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCache.SaveCacheInfo(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCacheInfo)
member.summary: Saves the document cache info.
member.param: The document cache info.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCache.LoadCacheInfo(GleamTech.Caching.FileCacheKey)
member.summary: Loads the document cache info that was saved before.
member.param: The cache key for the object.
member.returns: A instance.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCache.PreCacheDocument(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentOptions)
member.summary: Pre-caches a document. Normally the source document is converted to a special web-friendly format (XPZ) and cached after the document viewer is displayed in the page and when the document is viewed for the first time. With this method, you can do the conversion and caching beforehand so this way, when a user opens the document for the first time, there will be no waiting and the document will be loaded immediately from the cache. If the source document is already converted and cached, then this method will do nothing and return the existing cached item.
member.param: The document options of for pre-caching.
member.returns: A instance for the cached XPZ file, this object contains information like cache key.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCache.GetOrAddPdf(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCacheInfo)
member.summary: Gets or adds the PDF cache file. This method handles the first step of the conversion: Source -> PDF. Normally you would not need to call this method directly because calling only method handles the conversion chain Source -> PDF -> XPZ.
member.param: The document cache info.
member.returns: A instance for the cached PDF file, this object contains information like cache key.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCache.GetOrAddXpz(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCacheInfo)
member.summary: Gets or adds the XPZ cache file. This method handles the second step of the conversion: PDF -> XPZ. Normally you would not need to call this method directly because calling only method handles the conversion chain Source -> PDF -> XPZ.
member.param: The document cache info.
member.returns: A instance for the cached XPZ file, this object contains information like cache key.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCacheInfo
member.summary: Represents the cache information for a document.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCacheInfo.CacheSourceKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for the source. This is the parent key and is unique for a document. This key is used in subfolder names in the cache folder to group outputs for the same input.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCacheInfo.CachePdfKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for PDF. This key corresponds to the cache item which is the first step of the conversion: Source -> PDF. This format is used both as an input to XPZ and as the file for "Download as PDF" button.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCacheInfo.CacheXpzKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for XPZ. This key corresponds to the cache item which is the second step of the conversion: PDF -> XPZ. This format is the web-friendly format used by the DocumentViewer.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCacheInfo.CacheInfoKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for this object.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentCacheInfo.CacheCopyKey
member.summary: Gets the cache key for the copy of the source. This key is used only when the source needs to be serialized. The source stream is copied to the cache folder for serialization. This is currently done when you use so that your source is available out of the context of your page that hosts .

member.summary: Represents the result of method.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentInfo.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.Nullable{GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentFormat})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The unique identifier that will be used for generating the cache key for this document. For instance, it can be an ID from your database table or a simple file name; you just need to make sure this ID varies for each different document so that they are cached correctly. For example for files on disk, we internally use a string combination of file extension, file size and file date for uniquely identifying them, this way cache collisions do not occur and we can resuse the cached file even if the file name before extension is changed (because it's still the same document).

The file name which will be used for display purposes such as when downloading the document within or for the subfolder name prefix in cache folder. It will also be used to determine the document format from extension if parameter is not specified. If not specified or empty, will be used as the file name.

The format of the document. If not specified, the format will be automatically determined from the file extension in or . If your file name does not have an extension, you should explictly specify the correct format so that can correctly load the document.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentSource
member.summary: Defines a document that can be loaded either from a stream or a byte array. This class is a convenient alternative to interface which requires the developer to maintain the state. However with this class you can load a stream or a byte array that is only available in the context of your host page. is more robust but this class is easier to use. Note that your stream or byte array will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists when you load via because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed).

example.para: Load document from a byte array:
Load document from a stream callback:
Load document from a byte array callback:

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentSource.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentInfo,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.StreamResult)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document stream.
member.param: The object which contains necessary info to identify the document.

The stream containing the document. The stream is not required to be seekable because it will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists. This is because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed).

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentSource.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentInfo,System.Func{GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.StreamResult})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document stream callback.
member.param: The object which contains necessary info to identify the document.

The callback method to return an opened stream containing the document. The returned stream is not required to be seekable because it will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists. This is because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed). This callback will only be called when necessary, i.e. if the stream is already cached before then the callback will not be called. You can prefer callback over a direct instance when you need extra performance; consider opening the stream is costly in your implementation, for example you are retrieving it from network or a database or even from a zip file so opening the stream only when it's really necessary would be more performant when your document is viewed several times by several users.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentSource.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentInfo,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document byte array.
member.param: The object which contains necessary info to identify the document.

The byte array containing the document. This byte array will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists. This is because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed).

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentSource.#ctor(GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentInfo,System.Func{System.Byte[]})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the specified document byte array callback.
member.param: The object which contains necessary info to identify the document.

The callback method to return a byte array containing the document. The returned byte array will be copied to the cache folder if not already exists. This is because DocumentViewer needs to access your document out of the context of the host page (i.e. serialization is needed). This callback will only be called when necessary, i.e. if the byte array is already cached before then the callback will not be called. You can prefer callback over a direct instance when you need extra performance; consider retrieving the byte array is costly in your implementation, for example you are retrieving it from network or a database or even from a zip file so retrieving the byte array only when it's really necessary would be more performant when your document is viewed several times by several users.

member.summary: Provides properties and methods for changing this library's configuration for web use.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with custom configuration.
member.param: The configuration to use instead of the global configuration.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets the location to store cached documents. The default value is "~/App_Data/DocumentCache". The location can be a plain physical/virtual path string or a instance for one of the supported file systems like Amazon S3 and Azure Blob.

example.para: Using physical/virtual path for cache location:
Using Amazon S3 for cache location:

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.CachePath
member.summary: Gets or sets the path to store cached documents. The default value is "~/App_Data/DocumentCache". Value can be a virtual or physical path. Deprecated, please use CacheLocation instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheMaxAge
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum amount of time to consider a cached item fresh and keep it stored in the cache. Cached items older than this age will be removed when the cache trimming (clean up) runs (when auto trim is run or when Trim method is manually called). The default value is 90 days. In string representation, value in format "d" is considered days (e.g. "30" is 30 days) and value in format "hh:mm" is considered hours and minutes (e.g. "1:30" is 1 hour and 30 minutes). Note that "24:00" would mean 24 days as hour range is 0 to 23 and minute range is 0 to 59. See documentation for details on possible string representations.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheMaxDays
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of days to store cached documents. The default value is 90 days. Deprecated, please use CacheMaxAge instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheWaitTimeout
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the maximum amount of time to wait for a cached item to be available (wait for a file lock from other threads or processes to become available, i.e. wait for an ongoing caching of the same file to complete) before giving up on the cache request. The default value is 5 minutes. In string representation, value in format "d" is considered days (e.g. "30" is 30 days) and value in format "hh:mm" is considered hours and minutes (e.g. "1:30" is 1 hour and 30 minutes). Note that "24:00" would mean 24 days as hour range is 0 to 23 and minute range is 0 to 59. See documentation for details on possible string representations.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheAutoTrimInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the interval to run automatic cache trimming (clean up). Cached items older than will be removed when the cache is trimmed. If the value is 0 or negative, the auto trim is disabled. The default value is 20 minutes. In string representation, value in format "d" is considered days (e.g. "30" is 30 days) and value in format "hh:mm" is considered hours and minutes (e.g. "1:30" is 1 hour and 30 minutes). Note that "24:00" would mean 24 days as hour range is 0 to 23 and minute range is 0 to 59. See documentation for details on possible string representations.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheEncryptionEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether encryption of documents should be enabled. The default is true. Document viewer downloads a special document format (XPZ) on the client-side but for additional security (DRM), the document is also encypted by default.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.EncryptionEnabled
member.summary: Gets a value that specifies whether encryption of documents should be enabled. The default is true. Document viewer downloads a special document format (XPZ) on the client-side but for additional security (DRM), the document is also encypted by default. Deprecated, please use CacheEncryptionEnabled instead.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.CacheKeepVariations
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to keep variations of document conversion results. The default is false. For instance when you change watermark options, both Pdf and Xpz outputs are regenerated. By default the Pdf and Xpz outputs are replaced in cache when watermarks are changed. If you set this property to true, the Pdf and Xpz outputs will not be replaced but all variations will be kept in cache instead. This can be useful especially when you want different outputs for different users. So this way, for instance you can have different watermarked variations for each different user.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.GetCache
member.summary: Gets the document cache used by this web configuration instance.
member.returns: A instance.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentUltimateWebConfiguration.DocumentViewerHandlerPath
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies the path for the document viewer handler. The default value is "documentviewer.ashx". Normally you would not need to change the default value.

member.summary: Represents an object for handling of the input files in . Implement this interface to provide a custom way of loading the input files.

example.para: Sample IDocumentHandler implementation for loading documents from a database:
Sample IDocumentHandler implementation for passing multiple parameters at once:

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.IDocumentHandler.GetInfo(System.String,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentHandlerParameters)
member.summary: Gets the required information which corresponds to the current input file. This method will be called every time DocumentViewer requests a document. The cache key and document format will be determined according to the info you return here. The returned determines the cache key, so when uniqueId is changed it's considered a different file.
member.param: The input file that was requested to be loaded in , i.e. the value that was set in property.
The custom parameters to be used in your handler implementation i.e. the parameters that were set in property.
member.returns: A instance initialized with required information.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.IDocumentHandler.OpenRead(System.String,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.InputOptions,GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.AspNet.DocumentHandlerParameters)
member.summary: Opens a readable stream which corresponds to the current input file. This method will be called only when original input document is required to be read by the DocumentViewer, for example if DocumentViewer already did the required conversions and cached the results, it will not be called.
member.param: The input file for the current document conversion.
The input options that was specified for the current document conversion.
The custom parameters to be used in your handler implementation i.e. the parameters that were set in property.
member.returns: A instance initialized with a readable object.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.CadInputOptions.RenderBackgroundColor

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.CadInputOptions.RenderForegroundColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of the drawing when it's rendered. The default is null, which means foreground colors will be kept same as in the drawing. When set, all foreground colors will be fixed to this same color. For example, you can have a black and white or a blueprint output.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageOutputOptions.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets desired resolution for the generated images, in dots per inch (DPI). The default value is 96 DPI. For example, when DPI is 96 and input document page is 8 inches wide, the output image width will be 96*8 = 768 pixels. So the output dimensions (width and height) depends both input document dimensions and DPI.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.NamespaceDoc
member.summary:
This is the core namespace of this library, it contains classes used to convert document files to another format.
The main classes in this namespace are:
is the class for converting between document file formats.
defines the supported file formats for document conversion.
is the base class for input options used for document conversion.
is the base class for output options used for document conversion.
is the class for changing this library's configuration (e.g. setting license key).

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.NumberRange
member.summary: Represents a range of numbers.

remarks.para: The range is specified as a string in the following forms or combination thereof:

item.description: open range (converted to a sequence from 1 to 5)
open range (converted to a sequence from 1 to final number)

remarks.para: The value delimiter can be either ',' or ';' and the range separator can be either '-' or ':'. Whitespace is permitted at any point in the input.
Any elements of the sequence that contain non-digit, non-whitespace, or non-separator characters or that are empty are ignored.

member.summary: Gets or sets the range of sheet numbers to output. Default is "all". A string representation of number ranges (e.g. 1-5, 8, 11-13) or keywords (all, even, odd, visible, active) can be directly assigned to this property.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderColumnsFitToPages
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages the columns should fit when it's rendered. The default is 0 which means columns could be broken into multiple pages if required. For example if you set the value 1, all columns would be rendered on a single page.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderRowsFitToPages
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pages the rows should fit when it's rendered. The default is 0 which means rows could be broken into multiple pages if required. For example if you set the value 1, all rows would be rendered on a single page.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderHeadings
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether column (e.g. A, B) and row (e.g. 1, 2) headings are rendered on pages. The default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderGridlines
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether cell gridlines are rendered on pages. The default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderTitleColumns
member.summary: Gets or sets the columns that contain the cells to be repeated on the left side of each page. For example "$A:$A" specifies first column only and "$A:$C" specifies first, second and third columns.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderTitleRows
member.summary: Gets or sets the rows that contain the cells to be repeated at the top of each page. For example "$1:$1" specifies first row only and "$1:$3" specifies first, second and third rows.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderArea
member.summary: Gets or sets the range to be rendered. For example "A1:K15" specifies a range of A to K columns and 1 to 15 rows.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderBlackAndWhite
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the document will be rendered in black and white. The default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderCenterHorizontally
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the sheet is centered horizontally when rendered. The default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.SpreadsheetInputOptions.RenderCenterVertically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether the sheet is centered vertically when rendered. The default is false.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark
member.summary: Represents a set of image watermark options used for document conversion.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark.#ctor(System.IO.Stream,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a image stream.
member.param: The image stream to use as the watermark. The stream will be disposed automatically after it's used.

The version of the image stream, only useful when the watermark is used with DocumentViewer. As the image source is not on disk, information like file date and size will not be available for unique cache key calculation so you can make DocumentViewer know that you changed the source image by manually incrementing this version value. This way DocumentViewer can recognize the change, invalidate the cached document and force watermarking with new image. Instead of incrementing, you can also pass some kind of hash or DateTime.Ticks, of course the value should only change when the image is actually changed.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.ImageWatermark.#ctor(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from a instance.
member.param: The bitmap to use as the watermark. The bitmap will be disposed automatically after it's used.

The version of the image bitmap, only useful when the watermark is used with DocumentViewer. As the image source is not on disk, information like file date and size will not be available for unique cache key calculation so you can make DocumentViewer know that you changed the source image by manually incrementing this version value. This way DocumentViewer can recognize the change, invalidate the cached document and force watermarking with new image. Instead of incrementing, you can also pass some kind of hash or DateTime.Ticks, of course the value should only change when the image is actually changed.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image file to use as the watermark.

member.summary: Gets the version of image file to use as the watermark. This is calculated automatically for physical files.

The end page number of the range. If value is null, range is considered an open range from to final page.

member.name: M:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PageRange.Add(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a range of page numbers to the sequence from a string representation (e.g. 1-5, 8, 11-13).
member.param: The string containing the range of page numbers.

remarks.para: The range is specified as a string in the following forms or combination thereof:

item.description: open range (converted to a sequence from 1 to 5)
open range (converted to a sequence from 1 to final page)

remarks.para: The value delimiter can be either ',' or ';' and the range separator can be either '-' or ':'. Whitespace is permitted at any point in the input.
Any elements of the sequence that contain non-digit, non-whitespace, or non-separator characters or that are empty are ignored.

member.summary: Represents a set of PDF output options used for document conversion.

member.summary: Gets or sets the watermarks to apply for the document pages.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.PdfOutputOptions.FastWebViewEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether output should be linearized for fast viewing over the web. The default is false. Linearized PDF output (fast web view) has a big advantage when PDFs will be created and placed on a web server as a file. The first page of the PDF displays more quickly because the entire PDF does not need to be downloaded before it can be displayed. Pages can also be requested individually as they are needed while navigating through the document. Linearized PDFs are structured for optimized viewing, meaning the reader will have to do less work to display their content.

member.summary: Gets or sets the horizontal distance from left, right or center of document page; in points or in percentage (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) if is set to true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.VerticalDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the vertical distance from top, bottom or center of document page; in points or in percentage (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height) if is set to true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.DistanceIsPercentage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how to handle and values. If true, is a percentage of the page width (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) and is a percentage of the page height (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height). If false, and are measured in points.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the watermark; in points or in percentage (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) if is set to true. If also is specified, the resulting width may be smaller than the given one to maintain the aspect ratio. For text watermaks, only percentage values are accepted after setting to true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Height
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the watermark; in points or in percentage (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height) if is set to true. If also is specified, the resulting height may be smaller than the given one to maintain the aspect ratio. For text watermaks, only percentage values are accepted after setting to true.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.SizeIsPercentage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating how to handle and values. If true, is a percentage of the page width (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page width) and is a percentage of the page height (e.g. 50 is 50% of the page height). If false, and are measured in points.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Rotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation angle in degrees of the watermark.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of the watermark. Default is 100. Values are between 0 and 100. Value 0 is invisible, value 100 is fully visible.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.InBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be added as a background layer to a document page. Default is false.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.AnnotationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be added as an annotation to a document page. Default is false. will not work with annotation mode. Note that enabling this property is currently not supported for but it can be enabled when generating PDF documents directly via .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.PrintVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be displayed when printed. Default is true. Note that disabling this property is currently not supported for but it can be disabled when generating PDF documents directly via .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.ScreenVisible
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if the watermark should be displayed on screen. Default is true. Note that disabling this property is currently not supported for but it can be disabled when generating PDF documents directly via .

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.Watermark.PageRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of page numbers to add the watermark to. Default is "all". A string representation of number ranges (e.g. 1-5, 8, 11-13) or keywords (all, even, odd) can be directly assigned to this property.

member.name: T:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.DocumentConverter
member.summary: Provides methods for .

example.para: You can use static Convert method to easily convert an input document to another format:
You can use static CanConvert method to check beforehand if an input document can be directly converted another format:

You can also create an instance of DocumentConverter class with an input document and call instance methods ConvertTo and CanConvertTo. This is useful especially when you want to convert the same input document to several output formats:
You can enumerate possible output document formats for a given input document file with EnumeratePossibleOutputFormats method and vice versa with EnumeratePossibleInputFormats method:

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.WordProcessingInputOptions.FieldFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets the value to be used for the FileName field in a Word document. When the input is a file on disk, this field is automatically updated to the original file name when saved. However when the input is a stream, the file name will not be known so you can set this property to make sure FileName field contains the correct file name.

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.WordProcessingInputOptions.UpdateFields
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating if fields should be updated before the document is rendered/converted. The default is true. When set to true, it will mimic default "Save as PDF" or "Print" behaviour in Microsoft Word. For example, if you see "Error! Reference Source Not Found" messages instead of clickable links in the rendered document, you can set this to false (until you actually fix reference errors in your document).

member.name: P:GleamTech.DocumentUltimate.XpzOutputOptions.HighQualityEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies whether to produce high quality XPZ. The default is false. For providing some guarantees regarding how quickly a page can be rendered on different systems such as mobile devices, by default some parts of a page that are very complex and would take really long to render in the browser, are rasterized to an image (flattened). However as a side effect, parts of some pages may look blurry when you zoom in. You can set this property to true to disable this possible flattening (if you observe it's happening with your specific document). This way you can ensure vector quality rendering for complex documents such as CAD drawings. If you have errors due to insufficient memory, keep it at false.
